H0.text: Changing a theory is part of the scientific method that involves collecting data.

H1.text: Test a hypothesis is part of a scientific method that involves collecting data.

H2.text: Write a procedure is the purpose of collecting data as part of the scientific method.

H3.text: Making an observation is part of a scientific method that involves collecting data.

A4.text: The scientific method involves making conjectures (hypotheses), predicting their logical consequences, then carrying out experiments or empirical observations based on those predictions.

A5.text: The scientific method is an empirical method for acquiring knowledge through careful observation, rigorous skepticism, hypothesis testing, and experimental validation.

A6.text: The formulated hypothesis is then evaluated, where the hypothesis is proven to be either 'true' or 'false' through a verifiability- or falsifiability-oriented experiment.

A7.text: A hypothesis requires more work by the researcher in order to either confirm or disprove it.
